Reviews.Title: “Very enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: BrianGK
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel for the past six years, once or twice a year.Very pleasant staff, good service. Rooms are comfortable and clean.Maintenance sometimes an issue. Location is excellent in the very heart of the Zocalo, or main square of Mexico City.The manager is very kind and accomodating.. Restaurant is a franchise and quality of food only fair. I will be back later this year again.

Reviews.Title: “A very good hotel when you consider its location on the Plaza de la Constitucion”
Reviews.Author: kaw118
Reviews.Content: This was a hotel we stayed at on four different occasions over a one month period, our first stay did not start too well - insted of twin beds we were given a room with a queen bed (4 ft 6ins in width) and the following morning when we arrived at breakfast early only to find all the tables were taken by European tour groups - it had rained & the terrace was closed. Having spoken to the efficient reception staff before departure, on our next & subsequent visits we had a twin room (OK it was small, but it was perfectly formed & quiet). Breakfasts also improved, the terrace was open plus an overflow area immediately before the main dinning room. Bathroom was fine - good shower head - but no sink plug! I do not understand why Holiday Inns recognise that they have French, German, Spanish & Italian guests and as such provide a TV station for them. For English speakers, other than Americans, there is no world news programme: CNN is by the USA for the USA. At least at this Holiday Inn there was free use of the internet in the lobby. The staff are very friendly & helpful & I would recommend this hotel to you Finally for a special meal, try the Casa de las Sirenas, which is behind the Cathedral at 12 Republica de Guatemala.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing location”
Reviews.Author: GH22
Reviews.Content: The hotel is right on the central square of Mexico City, looking straight at the cathedral. Breakfast on the open balcony on the rooftop is staggering, and you can linger over the food for some time. We had a room overlooking the Zocalo so we had a good view. Some of the rooms though, are on the small side. An excellent hotel

Reviews.Title: “TERRIBLE reception staff”
Reviews.Author: alice6663
Reviews.Content: i stayed here for 4 night late in december 2011, it included buffet breakfast each morning. during that whole time i was never informed by the staff that on my last morning the breakfast would open at 8am and not the usual 7am. so i arrived for breakfast at 7am and waited 15 minutes then went to reception. i had a taxi picking me up to take to airport at 8am so i asked for a packed breakfast to take to airport with me but the rude reception lady just said no, she didnt even go and ask the kitchen. i dont understand this hotel at all, they had 45 mintues in which to pack me a breakfast but they still refused even though i had already pre paid for a buffet breakfast!!. the rude reception lady said i should have pre asked for it the night before, but how the hell can i when i wasnt even informed of this???. she told me i just had to go without breakfast, how rude is she?? thats when i asked to see the manager but she told me he doesnt get in till 8am. so in their customer complaints book at reception i wrote what happened and she assures me the manager would read it and definently respond back. its now been 5 weeks and i have not heard back at all from that manager . i told them i was unhappy with the service and i would write bad feedback and they still made no effort to solve this. they obviously dont care about their customers. so be warned. VERY VERY bad customer service. ive stayed at several of these hotels in Australian and USA and not once have i had any problems. or problems unsolved until now. even though this hotel has a good location i would NEVER EVER stay here again. its extremely noisy so do not expect to get any sleep and OMG the paper thin walls so you can hear everyone talking and hear when their tv's are on. then there is the outside noise, trucks going past constantly all night and the noise from the plaza. and yes as other people have commented on, the rooms are VERY tiny, there is barely enough room to walk pass the end of the bed. if you must stay here then buy some earplugs because you will need them.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing food”
Reviews.Author: BalletDancer15
Reviews.Content: It's a really nice hotel, with a restaurant on the roof wich includes an amazing view to "el zocalo", eventhough the rooms are small, the beds are comfortable and the bathroom is big. What I most liked about this hotel was the restaurant with a delicious mexican food buffet they served every morning. I dined there all the nights of my trip and I really enjoyed it. Probably because it is located on the center of Mexico it is kind of noisy, so if you need silence to relax you could think about this twice :)

Reviews.Title: “Rooftop restaurant”
Reviews.Author: viajeramx1
Reviews.Content: The location is outstanding. You can see the Zocalo, the big mexican flag, the Cathedral and Palacio Nacional. It is a wonderful spot but service needs to be improved. Waiters are really slow and I guess they rely on the place being so turistic that they do not make an extra effort. Strange in Mexico to see waiters that are not truly commited to serve you the best.

Reviews.Title: “More cons than pros”
Reviews.Author: Torquemada_lives
Reviews.Content: Location is not always the most important thing to consider when you choose a hotel. This hotel has the best location if your visit is for pleasure. However it's also chosen by wedding planners that will not let you sleep either because of the noisy orchesta at the top restaurant or the noisy doors slamming at 3, 4 or 5 am, or the crew dragging chairs and tables at 2am over your ceiling. The Cinco de Mayo stret is noisy, a lot of police car run noisily with their sirens at any time. Pros: - great location, the top restaurant has great views over the Zocalo. - ATM by the lobby. - clean, wifi, parking (don't use a car if not necessary!!) Cons: - noisy, noisy, noisy. - small rooms (I'm an European and I know what "small" room means...) - the buffet is not very variated though the quality is high. The servers are not consistent in their service: you always see groups of 3-4 servers chatting while you're waiting for your coffee refill, or just trying to make eye-contact with them. Some servers are rude. - Not nice when yoy leave the building in the morning and find 8-10 policemen in the lobby highly armed. I'm a Holiday Inn customer and I've been in their hotels worldwide. I will not come back to this one even when this location is good. The public transport is not expensive and it's worth to grab a room at Paseo de la Reforma or Polanco.

Reviews.Title: “Top location”
Reviews.Author: Casabrava
Reviews.Content: The best is like already mentioned by many reviewers the locations directly at the ZÃ³calo. You go out and are amidst everything. There are lots of restaurants in walking distance and we felt safe walking at night cause there are always people on the street. The room was small but cosy, it was clean. The rooftop restaurant has an excellent view but only average service. The hotel is visited by many travel groups.

Reviews.Title: “restaurant review”
Reviews.Author: chica60
Reviews.Content: I've not stayed at this hotel, but I have eaten in their restaurant twice. First of all the food is just ok, nothing to write home about. But that is not my complaint because obviously our group was there strictly for the lovely view. During one of our visits we were ignored for the most part, and when the food was finally brought out to us it was done in intervals of at least 5 minutes apart. That's not the way to serve a meal. The last time we were there, the service was more coordinated, but as we start to dig in to our dinner, one of the persons that was in our group spits his food out into his napkin and low and behold there are cubes of GLASS in his steak taco! It was absolutely horrible! The server was standing not more than 2 feet from our table. We called him over, but his response and managements response was terrible. Needless to say, we will never return to this restaurant again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel at a super location !!!”
Reviews.Author: macrokr55
Reviews.Content: Just spent 3 nights at the Holiday Inn Zocalo. Just a great little hotel right in the heart of downtown Mexico City. Be sure and get the package that includes the breakfast buffet every morning. It is 1st class and not to be missed. The rooms are nice, though not large, and kept very clean as was the bathroom. Service at all times was 1st class and very friendly. Cabs were available to anywhere in the City with the prices posted in the lobby which was very handy. A few minutes notice to the concierge near the door was all that was necessary to book a cab. Also was able to book a cab and driver for the day at a very reasonable price to take our group (my brother, his wife and I) to Cuernavaca Mexico for a nice day trip in a comfortable manner. Much easier and relaxing than renting a car and driving and figuring directions on your own. Mexico City is not for the feint of heart if you are not used to that kind of driving. Probably the nicest part about this hotel is the location. The Zocalo is right at the heart of Mexico City and you are within walking distance of all kinds of nice restraunts, shopping, archaeological sites (pyramids and temples next to the cathedral), the national cathedral, and many other things nearby. Also is very close to the airport. I have traveled to Mexico City many times over my lifetime and this is probably the best area as a base of operations outside of a private home I have stayed at. Can't be beat !!!

Reviews.Title: “Best Location, small rooms, watch up restaurant service at night”
Reviews.Author: Antoines
Reviews.Content: The hotel location is unbeatable, the rooms are small, in the web site they offer Garden botanika amenities but they acctually give Soften toiletries a spanish low cost ones. Coffe maker in room as promised, soft bathrobe, safebox, the hotel web also offer FREE BUFFET BREAKFAST this is from the web site: http://www.holidayinn.com/hotels/us/en/mexico-city/mexdt/hoteldetail/hotel-room-rates "You'll find that in Mexico City, our hotel's rooms offer comfort along with stylish furnishings. From the perks like free Internet access and a cable television that has channels in many languages to a large work desk and chair, you'll have everything you need for a comfortable stay.. Premium Services " Buffet Breakfast, complimentary daily well thats not true, we had to pay about 10 usd each in order to get "the free breaksfast buffet" overrall is the best location in mexico city historic center. this is not a 5 star hotel but a proper 3 star.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, small rooms.”
Reviews.Author: nellymty
Reviews.Content: I stayed at This hotel as part of a 1 night stay business trip. I got a very small room facing the street and it was very noisy. The view from the roof top restaurant is really nice and the food was ok. I had lunch but it was not as tasty as I expected it to be and maybe because it was a little late for lunch they had not as a wide variety as they normally have. The bed was comfortable and the bathroom was ok. Not as big as some others but ok. The shower head was very good. They told me this was a old hotel that they had recently made a Holiday Inn so it could explain the size of the rooms. It was very well located just across Zocalo, Catedral and Palacio Nacional. You could see all the Zocalo and even a little bit of the ruins. If you want to walk at Centro Historico is an excellent Hotel to book but if you want silence you might try some other location.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: BBCPDX
Reviews.Content: We had a great view right on the Plaza across from the Cathedral. A very comfortable hotel, clean and convenient to everything. The desk staff was very helpful, except for their lack of advice about how to take the local buses (they seem impossible to decifer anyways). I'd recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “"The Place" for a tourist!”
Reviews.Author: imacbeth
Reviews.Content: This hotel is bang on the main square (Zocalo) so if you want the sights and the shopping its all around you. Rooftop dining with good food and fantastic view or there are plenty of places to eat out within an easy walk. Attentive staff - nice and clean.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for wedding weekend with friends”
Reviews.Author: okum0003
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a friend's wedding with a large group from the U.S. The hotel is very comfortable, clean, and we had excellent service all weekend. The patio bar and breakfast area overlooks the Zocolo which was a great start to the day or perfect for an evening nightcap. Right in the middle of everything, the Zocolo, Cathedral and President's palace were all within 1/2 a block. Great pedestrian mall nearby too. Far more charming than I expected for a Holiday Inn!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - NOT a 5 Star Hotel”
Reviews.Author: tammynnc
Reviews.Content: I went back and forth on whether to give this 3 or 4 stars. I was extremely disappointed as a PC Plat at not receiving any acknowledgment of my status whatsoever, didn't receive an upgrade or even so much as a free breakfast but for the vast majority of people reading this, that is irrelevant so I wont take it into account. The hotels website lists it as a 5-Star hotel. That is a joke. This place is not 5 star, it is not even 4 star. It is a solid 3 star hotel, nothing more. The only thing 5-star about this place is the location. The location simply can not be beat. That was the reason that I chose it. The restaurant on the 6th floor is gorgeous, stunning, can't say enough about it. The food was good, and reasonably priced for dinner with an incredible view. Service was ok, but only 1 waiter spoke passable English. The breakfast buffet was ok, but at 150 pesos, way overpriced. Free internet was extremely fast, perhaps the fastest I have ever experienced in a hotel. The lobby was small and cramped. The rooms were also small but very pretty. The bed was firm but comfortable. Great water pressure and very hot water in the large shower. They should have used some of that shower space elsewhere. The A/C in the room was very powerful and kept the room very cool. You did have to insert the key into the thingy to make the lights and AC work so once you left the room everything would turn off. The staff were very pleasant and the front desk staff all seemed to speak good English. Do not go here and expect a 4 or 5 star hotel but it is a very nice Holiday Inn in the best location in the city!

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel In A Great Location”
Reviews.Author: fun2travelCanberra
Reviews.Content: Check in was exceedingly slow at this hotel. When we were checking in there were three couples trying to check in and it seemed as though the staff were out of their depth. The rooms (we stayed there twice) were very small with no space for luggage. Perhaps if guests paid extra for a larger room that might help but the standard rooms were not good. The location of the hotel is its best feature as it is right on Zocalo Square. It is a minutes walk to the square where there are a number of things to see. The hotel restaurant is on the top floor so diners can look out over the square while having a meal. It can be noisy at the hotel if there happens to be a festival or concert etc in Zocalo Square. If I stayed there again I wouldn't stay in one of the hotel's standard rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Would not recommend”
Reviews.Author: nomza
Reviews.Content: I chose the Holiday Inn due to the brand, I am not a strong Spanish speaker and thought that there would be some english speaking staff in key areas. One of the door men and one receptionist were very helpful however all the staff in the restaurant are extremely poor english speakers. This resulted in my room service order not arriving after an hour, I called up and they did not understand why I was calling, when I said I had ordered at 9pm and it was now 10pm they responded with "one coca cola?". When someone finally came to my room they brought me chocolate cake instead of the pasta I had ordered. It was very frustrating. The hotel itself is lovely, but I was on the third floor and it was EXTREMELY loud from the traffic and activities going on in the square, luckily I am a deep sleeper. I am very happy with the location but I would probably stay somewhere else within the area.

Reviews.Title: “Surprisingly spacious”
Reviews.Author: TB0604
Reviews.Content: Had 2 nights in the hotel - had a nice, big room with a nice bathroom - everything I could want. Superb base for Mexico City itself & great views from the roof garden including hummingbirds coming to the feeders! A bit inpersonal & perhaps English not as well spoken as they might like to think but you cannot have everuything. They were excellent at organising taxis, ensuring you got on the internet & greeting you at the door - all lovely for a single female traveller. It was an excellent stopover en route for a more remote part of Mexico with fewer facilities & water at a premium.

Reviews.Title: “Central location”
Reviews.Author: lukeskywalker_fi
Reviews.Content: Great location right in the Zocolo. Seemed safe enough to me, to walk about, but always be alert. However is not a quiet location by any means, day or night. Aircon is also extreamly loud. Room fine, clean and tidy and everything works -although a bit tired looking. Tried the open top bus yesterday (hop on hop off) , of some of bigger city centre sites and good value at 9Euro. No swiming pool or place to relax, but as this really is down town only to be expected. Overall great value for a central hotel in Mexico City.

Reviews.Title: “What a view!”
Reviews.Author: SavvyTraveller001
Reviews.Content: I had picked this hotel because of its location...right on the Zocalo..it did not disappoint! If you are on a first-time visit to Mexico City, this hotel will cater to all your needs. I was able to access public transit, secure an authorized taxi or walk to many of the locations I had hoped to see during my whirl-wind 4 day stop in this facinating city. Be aware that most rooms are very small...not a problem for me - a solo traveller....but may be a consideration to others. Kudos to the housekeeping personnel: rooms were clean & very well-maintained ...with all the amenities one would expect of the Holiday Inn franchise. While the 6th floor restaurant offered a stunning view, the food was just "edible" - a major shock for me after experiencing the varied delights of Oaxacan cuisine in the month prior to arriving in D.F.. Staff & service: degree of service was inconsistent and varied with individuals providing it. Ranged from exceptional (tourist desk in lobby) to uninterested (particularly in late afternoon & evening for personnel at reception desk & with some restaurant personnel) Good choice & very good value for the location.

Reviews.Title: “Wouldnt return!”
Reviews.Author: Lornstar7
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for two nights at the end of a three week trip to Mexico and was thoroughly dissapointed! The hotel itself is lovely - the rooms are wonderful, we had a suite with a huge jacuzzi in the room, and a view right over the Zocalo, looking out to the Cathedral, but unfortunately the service was so poor it really let the hotel down. We arrived at 4pm and was met by a very unhelpful, grumpy and rude female receptionist. She informed us that our room was not ready, without even a hint of an apology, we didnt mind too much as we had only arrived from an internal flight, but if we'd just arrived in Mexico city after a 10 hr flight we'd have been pretty upset! When our room was finally ready we didnt have hot water until the end of our second day's stay. We had to report this a total of 7 times to reception and were told they were too busy to fix it. Again no apology. The roof top bar/dining area is lovely and the food is OKish. Breakfast is OK, not great. It was a pity as the hotel is in such a great location, and the rooms are lovely - most of the porters were also thoroughly charming, just a shame about the receptionist and general lack of customer service. I also thought the hotel was incredibly overpriced for what it is. I wouldnt recommend this hotel to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: NettsG
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay here & am planning my third for later this year. I don't think there is a better location in Mexico City, right at the Zocalo & the views from the rooftop restaurant are fantastic. The staff are always friendly & helpful. On both of my stays my room has been good - both times a good sized room & the bathroom is very nice with all the amenities.

Reviews.Title: “Just right”
Reviews.Author: seekers38
Reviews.Content: We were afraid to book this hotel at first because many reviews were negative on the room being too small. Took a chance, we booked it. Fabulous, we were not in Mexico to stay in the room any way, so it was just right for us. Clean and roomy enough for us. Only issue we had was that the bathroom is hooked up to the TV, very odd to us. The location of the hotel was right in the center of city and has readily access to the subway. No car needed.

Reviews.Title: “TERRIBLE”
Reviews.Author: bajapi
Reviews.Content: This hotel is probably the worst Holiday Inn I have stayed at. I am a platinum Holiday Inn member and have stayed here before but this time I had to due to the location of being able to walk to my meetings. The room I was given was no bigger than my walk in closet at home. I am 6' tall and my feet were hanging over the bed. The restaurant is on the roof with a beautiful view of the Zocolo but the food was terrible and the prices were outrageous! Even the service staff at the restaurant acted like they were doing you a favor just by being in their restaurant. DO NOT STAY HERE!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Value for money at centre of Mexico”
Reviews.Author: giji365
Reviews.Content: The hotel is situated in Zocalo, the heart of culture in Mexico. I was fortunate to be there on a Sunday, as I could see a lot of tribals selling their stuff in the square near the church. The hotel is value for money with small but well done rooms. A/C was very powerful. Breakfast options were also good. I was fortunate to get some reception staff who could communicate in English. The best part of the stay was free broadband connection, at an amazing speed.

Reviews.Title: “Unbeatable location, but choose a suite”
Reviews.Author: david_andrews
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for a long weekend while I was spending a month in Mexico on business. Our first room was a small double. The bed was too short for my 6'2" frame, and had a window overlooking the atrium. I complained, and was told there were no other rooms in the hotel. Nevertheless, I looked online and booked another room (a suite) through an online site. It was significantly more expensive but still a bargain (about $135/night), and the management agreed to cancel the first reservation. I was thrilled to discover that we had a window looking directly across the street from DF's famous Cathedral, practically on top of it. We also had a jacuzzi in the room. There are amazing restaurants all around, and the staff, while a bit surly, did accomodate all of our needs. The area is quiete dead at night; stay in Coyoacan instead if you want nighlife. The rooftop restaurant has amazing views over the Zocalo and an acceptable buffet.

Reviews.Title: “Best value and view in Mexico City”
Reviews.Author: LaGringa1951
Reviews.Content: Absolutely the best place to stay for location and value. Have stayed here on four trips and see no reason to try another hotel in Mexico City.

Reviews.Title: “Small but clean and comfortable rooms, excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Mushashi
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Holiday Inn Zocalo for 4 nights in total at the begining and end of our holiday. The location is simply excellent and provides a fanstastic base for exploring the city. The rooms were very, very small but extremely clean. The staff were helpful and also the free Wi Fi helped me keep in contact with my office whilst I was away. Though the food in the restaurant (and also room service) is terrible, it has one of the best views in Mexico City and looks right across the main square and is well worth a visit to have a drink or two at sunset.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel at the Zocalo of Mexico City”
Reviews.Author: VeronicaI
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel, it has good service and the restaurant is at the top floor and you have a view of the Central Square (Zocalo). Right in front of it, you have the Metropolitan Cathedral of Mexico City. You can see its bells from the balcony. It is great.

Reviews.Title: “Good Choice for the price”
Reviews.Author: LangkawiBavaria
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Holiday Inn for 2 nights when we first came to Mexico City. The Holiday Inn is right at the historic center â€“ Zocalo â€“ and has a great terrace at the roof top where you have breakfast. You overlook the whole central place with the cathedral on one side. The Holiday Inn is a nice, standard hotel where you get what you expect from a chain. It is clean, the rooms are not too big, but absolutely adequate. The big advantage is staying at the center and being able to make several of the walking tours. The hotel staff is very friendly and helpful. The neighborhood offers a lively restaurant and shopping scene as well as a lot of historic monuments within walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent affordable choice for exploring historic downtown”
Reviews.Author: Maria-Tucson
Reviews.Content: Located on the northwest corner of the Zocalo (Monte de Piedad and 5 de Mayo streets), this hotel is a historic monument, with its interior completely improved. Its foundations were part of the palace of Moctezuma, and later of the residence of Hernan Cortez. The views from our corner room were wonderful. With very refined Mexican furniture and decoration, walk-in closet, vanity, toilet room, and shower room, big plasma TV, living room, AC controls on the wall with registers near the ceiling, wooden floors and ceiling with big vigas, the room was very comfortable and beautiful. Just be aware that, like the great majority of toilets anywhere in Mexico, you cannot throw toilet paper inside the toilet, because you will block it. This happened to my 7-year-old daughter, and the toilet room was flooded in no time. The hotel's staff attended our cry for help immediately, and they fixed up the toilet and cleaned the whole mess right away and with good attitude. The price of the room included a wonderful breakfast buffet, with fresh tropical fruit and juices, eggs made per your request, cereals, etc. The restaurant is located on the covered roof of the hotel, so you can enjoy the wonderful views and weather. The hallways are beautifully decorated with Mexican talavera ceramics and historic pictures and artifacts. We never made it to the exercise room. There is no pool. We felt very safe walking late at night in the Zocalo, because there is plenty of activity and policemen continuously patrolling by foot and car. There is a 24-hour 7-Eleven on the first floor of the hotel, facing the Zocalo. We had no problem with noise. If you think you may be sensitive to the noises of a big city, bring your earplugs and you'll be OK.

Reviews.Title: “Really excellent !!”
Reviews.Author: stefparis11
Reviews.Content: Just around Zocalo. Excellent location. Nice bedroom and hotel. Staff is friendrly especially if you speak spanish with them. Breakfast on terrace on the roof is really great. We arrived one day later and they even didn't ask us to pay for the night we didn't spend. I would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for sight seeing but resaturants nearby are not great, tiny rooms”
Reviews.Author: globetrotsun
Reviews.Content: Great location in the centre of mexico city for sight seeing. Rooms are tiny, beds are tiny too but overall decent value for money. The restaurants nearby are dinghy, didnt feel like going in, bad location for vegetarians. The hotel has a restaurant but its rather average. A better idea is to stay in one of the better locations (zona rosa, condesa etc) and take a metro to Zocalo for sight seeing and it would take only 10-15 mins to travel there. If food or room size is not your concern, I'd recommend this place. NOTE: The tours booked by this hotel are with a tour company that I wouldnt recommend. Try to book your own tours if possible, better yet, take a bus or metro on your own. We took a tour to Teotihucan through this hotel and did not like it at all (no fault of the hotel though). I think the company was called 'Estour' The tour was too expensive compared to other tour companies and the guide made us spend more time at the obsidian shop than at the pyramids!

Reviews.Title: “Just love it ! ... and has been loving it for the past 7 years !”
Reviews.Author: Ameweb
Reviews.Content: Let's be honnest, I have been living in Mexico ... I love the country and travel very often to this country to visit my friends. Everytime I have to stay in Mexico City, I go to this hotel: it is centrally located, it's not too big, it's afordable and last but not least.... it has a magnificiant terrace over looking the Zocalo ... the best place in town to have breakfast !!!! Staff is ok ... nothing exceptional .. as usual in Mexico a lot of people ... some will be helpfull... some will do the minimum ... I don't blame them considereing their salary ! I work for hotels so my expectations are very high. I think that the restaurant staff is always nicer than the reception as they receive 10-15% of the bill in tips. The rooms are fine, had a small refurbishement (LCD TVs). COmplimentary Internet in all the hotel (wifi: GREAT !) The lobby has also been refurbished lately, quite nice, but nothing ipressive. The only issue that I had with this hotel is that the access might not be easy some days when the Zocalo is closed... I even had a taxi who refused to go there as the traffic was getting crazy and as he did not know which road to take to arrive to the hotel ... not a good experience but not the hotel's fault !!! Just use the right taxi company at the airport ! (never use "Nueva Imagen" ). What elese can I say... once again the breakfast is fantastic !!!!! Definitely will continue to stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: BrooklynJarhead
Reviews.Content: rooms are not large but the place immaculate, the beds are nice, bathroom nice, water pressur good, the place is clean clean clean, prompt service, very helpful staff, good breakfast, great view from terrace of the palace and the military service at around 8 am, i would stay here again, price was perfect and would recommend to everybody on a budget

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely wonderful stay in centre of Mexico City, restaurant overlooks the zocalo.”
Reviews.Author: CDickie
Reviews.Content: Customer service excellent, always someone on staff that spoke English well as I spoke little. Bellman can accompany you if requested; one walked with me to TicketMaster outlet, another to nearby night club. Stayed in a junior suite with a huge jacuzzi tub, separate shower on 5th floor: wonderful decor, hardwood floors, and great bed. After using the jacuzzi I felt like an Emperor, wrapped in the huge toga-like towel. Offered bathrobes, slippers, safe, wireless internet, computer workstations and printing, all free, and will book tours/taxis for you. Restaurant on 6th floor overlooks the zocalo: make sure to see the flag-raising ceremony Monday to Saturday, it's impressive! Right next door is the National Cathedral and across the zocalo is the National Palace. Easy access to metro system and stop to the hop-on-off tour bus, and short walk to bank or money exchange. Surrounded by shopping opportunities and restaurants. Location is almost constant activity and noise: invigorating, lively, and truly memorable. Excellent location/service/price; not so excellent housekeeping (didn't automatically replenish bath amenities), no quiet lounge to sit and have a drink, no swimming pool. Still, the best Holiday Inn I have ever stayed in.

Reviews.Title: “FRIENDLY but Noisy”
Reviews.Author: paulboop
Reviews.Content: A terrific location right on the cityâ€™s main square ,very friendly staff ,smallish but well appointed rooms make this a good choice .Thereâ€™s only one hitch : This hotel is addicted to noise! The top floor buffet breakfast is very good and the view over the Zocalo is stunning .Why do they need two loud TVs spouting news and commercials? The corridors have loudspeakers so powerful that the music disturbs guests even inside their rooms! Daily ,persistent insistence ,with managerial authorization ,can get them to silence your floor but itâ€™s a pain in the ----ear!

Reviews.Title: “Location is everything”
Reviews.Author: Bezi
Reviews.Content: Great location for tourists. Our room was fine and breakfast on the balcony was great. If you get there at 8.00am you can see them putting up what must be the biggest flag in the world in the square opposite! I suspect some rooms can be noisy as there seems to be constant activity in the surrounding area but our room was quiet. There is an HSBC ATM machine at the entrance to the hotel which was handy and a tours desk to organise anything you might want to do around town. We didn't eat there (other than breakfast) as there are plenty of nice restaurants nearby. All in all we had a nice time there.

Reviews.Title: “Moderately Priced great value in a great location pleasant decore.”
Reviews.Author: SeniorDoug
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights and it was easy access to everyting in the central part of the city. I would not recommend the resturant for other than breakfast. Very helpful staff in planning daily trips to different points of interest. The Hotel had been recently renovated but in the style of Mexico and very tastefully done. The rooms were small but very comfortable. We would certainly stay there again when visiting Mexico City.

Reviews.Title: “Bad Customer Service and also bad smell”
Reviews.Author: WilsonGuallpa
Reviews.Content: When we got to the hotel they made us wait more than 3 hours for check in, telling us every 15 min. to wait another 15 min., Also we put the privacy sign at the door, went to have breakfast and the room service went inside anyway. I felt that they didnt respect my privacy. Also at night time I was sleeping and wake up at the middle of the night because it was a bad smell, like sewer. I dont recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and breakfast but beware of noise”
Reviews.Author: Florian254
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 nights and took the hotel as a basis to discover the city and the surroundings. Check in was friendly as was all the staff. The first room we had was on the small side and the biggest disadvantage was that it was towards the street i.e. it was pretty loud. But we could move (staff was very friendly and helpful in this matter as well as organising transport to the airport a few days later) to an inner room which was much roomier and a lot quiter. One big advantage of the hotel is the location, directly at the Zocalo, you only have 50m to the cathedral, the old temple and other attractions in this area. Big plus was the breakfast. It was served on the 6th floor with a balcony directly to the Zocalo and though the cold choices were not that special they had a big warm buffet with good typical mexican cuisine. For us a breakfast was enough so we could skip the lunch easily. Summry: A good place to use as a base to see Mexico City, and the value for money was fully ok.

Reviews.Title: “Liked this Holiday Inn”
Reviews.Author: Gerald33
Reviews.Content: We stayed here two nights. The hotel is located right at Constitution Plaza, across from the Metropolitan Cathedral. We picked it because of the downtown location. The hotel staff is very friendly and helps you with your every request. The restaurant on the 6th floor terrace has a good view of the city and the Plaza. They were having a concert in the Plaza the Saturday night we stayed here and you could not have asked for a better seat. Breakfast is not included in the room rate but they will make you almost anything you want. Our room was on the backside and was very quiet but a bit small. They have free WiFi. Everything seemed neat and well maintained. We found reliable English speaking tourist guides just a block away and you can arrange private or bus tours.

Reviews.Title: “Good for few days”
Reviews.Author: ross11ross
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel with my boyfriend for 3 days at the end of December. The room was clean, but a little bit too small. The location and the view from the balcony are fantastic. The staff was not so friendly and it was impossible to exchange money. But for 3 days it is good.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jfpTexas
Reviews.Content: We were there for 2 nights right before Christmas and it was very busy. The staff was very courteous, helpful and friendly. The internet service was great. I would be willing to stay there again but NOT at Christmastime. We all Loved the breakfast on the balcony....

Reviews.Title: “Great location and lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: g0g
Reviews.Content: This place is perfect for tourists looking to explore the city. Definitely worth paying that little bit extra for one of the rooms with a view onto the square - you can see the flag going up and down (including ceremony and army) each day. Breakfast on the balcony is a lovely start to the day. The food is good and if you have a seat at the edge of the balcony there are hummingbirds (I think) flying in! The terrace is also a great spot for dinner! Hotel staff (especially Jose Luis) were helpful organising tours (make sure to visit the pyramids) and offering recommendations. Felt very safe on the nearby streets at night and there were police on every corner.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, Terrible Service”
Reviews.Author: MIkaMika12
Reviews.Content: The Holiday Inn Zocalo has an excellent location and a friendly staff. I woudl qualify the rooms as OK, clean and fine but small and not particularly luxurious. Lookout if you need anything though. The staff is very friendly, butcfrequently seemed unable oto solve small problems such as the ATM being out of cash (I just wanted to know where another one was), or connect me to the concierge when I called the operator. They sent the bellboy to my room instead. The guest services button on the phone goes to a message saying the extension is out of order, while when room service closes at 11pm th number just rings and rings without a message or transferring you to the front desk. The gym is a small room with a treadmill and two weight machines in it. It has a TV and water, but could use better ventilation. The worst is the internet. There is none! There should be wireless on all floors, but the signal is so weak I have to reload basic pages over and over, reconnect every few minutes to whichever signal is strongest (never more than one bar, sometimes all connectivity is lost). I need to get work done and this is catastrophic for me. Every time I complain, and I have been for three days, I am given a different story - the wireless wont work because of the rain, we will reset the router and it will work (they did not) we are replacing the cables etc. No one at the hotel knows how to fix this key issue, and no one seems to be trying. When I explained that I confirmed that Internet was available and NEEDED to email things that day I was told to use the two computers in the lobby. I cant access my coroprate network through these computers. I asked for the location of a relieable connetion, they also didnt know wjere else I could go. I appreciate a friendly staff, but I appreciate them at least trying to fix the problem instead of just telling me a different story with every person I speak to a lot more. DO NOT COME HERE IF YOU ARE A BUSINESS TRAVELLER OR NEED TO GO ONLINE WHILE TRAVELING. Do go here if you want a nice location at a reasonable rate and are willing to go down to the front desk to straighten out every question or request.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and value!”
Reviews.Author: LifeofLeisure
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed my stay at the Holiday Inn Zocalo. It's not the fanciest hotel in Mexico City, but it is clean and has an amazing rooftop balcony restaurant overlooking Zocalo Square. There are great restaurants within walking distance (Opera, and Cafe Tacuba). Also within walking distance is the Palacio Nacional (with Diego Rivera's murals) and the Palacio de Bellas Artes. There is free internet on the computers in the lobby and wireless in the rooms. Downfalls: (1) many of the housekeeping staff members do not speak English well which may be inconvenient if you don't speak Spanish, (2) the service in the restaurant is not consistent -- sometimes really great and then others slow with errors in the order, (3) at times, taxi service was slow. Also, the rooms are on the small side, which didn't really bother me since they were clean and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “What a dump”
Reviews.Author: MarianaG
Reviews.Content: I was here for a one week conference and was assigned this hotel. It is a Holiday Inn. The beds are uncomfortable, the linens are poor, and the pillows tolerable. The comforter slides off the bed while you sleep. The rooms are noisy, since you are next to Zocola square. The staff is OK but just do there job and do not go out of their way to help you. For instance, my room was not cleaned well; i was to receive a fed-ex package and they were no help in locating it (I had to call fed-ex), my laundry showed up at my hotel room at 10:30 PM when I had the privacy on. The only merit is the location to Temple Mayor, shopping, and restaurants (there is a McDonalds and 7-Eleven next door). The restaurant at the hotel for breakfast was fine. It has a great view of the square and service was good. I would stay elsewhere like the Sheraton Historico or Four Seasons next time.

Reviews.Title: “At home in Holiday Inn Zocalo”
Reviews.Author: maryval
Reviews.Content: If you're a history and culture buff, then Holiday Inn Zocalo in Mexico City will be a hit for you. Located at the corner of 5 de Mayo, one of the streets surrounding that great square called the Zocalo, you will be near the Metropolitan Cathedral, the National Government Building, the Mexico City Government Building, and some archeological finds like the Templo Mayor within walking distance. We arrived at about 10 pm on a Thursday. When the reception clerk couldn't understand us, the English speaking Mr. Carlos Mata was called to help us. We were shown to our room with a double bed and 3 pillows. The bathroom has a good hot and cold shower which was easy to adjust to the right temperature. Bathroom amenities incuded 3 big towels, three hand towels, three small towels with 1 bath robe, plus the usual soap, shampoo and conditioner small bottles. Surprise! there was a small can of shoe polish, interesting, isn't it? The room was equipped with a personally controlled airconditioner (which was a big bonus since we can decide when we want it cold or warm inside the room). Breakfast is more than sufficient with the buffet table laden with fruits, fruit juices, french toast, pancakes, Mexican breakfast staples. There was a corner to order eggs as you like it, sunny side up or scrambled, with a lovely senorita cooking on the spot for you. Endless coffee refills as you wanted. But the best part is the view of the whole Zocalo square ...where the 8:00 ritual of flag raising is done. You have to see it and feel the Mexican spriri of pride as a retinue of soldiers emerge from the National Government building, complete with a brass band, then raise the biggest flag I have seen at the middle of the square. The hotel staff is another wonderful thing. If you're ever booked there, look for Mr. Daniel Aguilar at the Concierge's table. He speaks very good English and is a wealth of information on where to go, what to do, and is a big help on your travel needs. He was a big help to us when we were anxiously waiting for our tour guide, approaching us without our even asking and "taking charge" of the situation. Very friendly man, this Daniel. Mr. Carlos Mata was also a big help especially when we found out our reservation for our flight to Vancouver had been cancelled. He called up Mexicana and arranged eveything for us. The best thing though is the price. Our travel agency was able to get us a room for 6 nights, with buffet breakfast, transfers to and from the airport, half-day city tour, tour to the Basilica and the Teotihuacan pyramids and the Xochimilco floating gardens for only US$590 per person. Thumbs up for this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: darthvaderpr
Reviews.Content: I was supposed to arrive at 7.30 PM. I remember when I arrived at 2:35 AM (because my American Airlines flight got delayed) . The check in staff asked me why did I check in that time. When I replied it was a flight delay, they immediately gave me everything (room card key, breakfast coupons and helped me with my luggage). When I reached my room, I gave a tip to the employee, but he said it wasn't necessary. My room got everything, even a jacuzzi (I did not expected it). During my stay, all staff were friendly and courteous. The hotel is near many stores and it is quite interesting because you can hear and see the Mexican army raising the national flag at 6AM and lowering it at 6PM. I'm likely to return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Historical Location”
Reviews.Author: GCTourist
Reviews.Content: We spent seven nights in Acapulco and took a bus to Mexico City for nine nights. The Holiday Inn Zocalo was my first selection as our hotel. I made the reservations with the free Holiday Inn 800 number. The location is perfect. Everything anyone would need is within walking distance. For example, the post office is just around the corner. The subway stop is in the zocalo square. If you like fast food, McDonald's is a few doors from the hotel. And, there are various restaurants and bakeries all around the area. The national pawn shop is across the side street, and there are venders throughout the area. The maid service was very, very good and the front desk helpful. Above all, the bell boys were outstanding. English is not generally spoken, but Rosario, David, and Carlos knew enough English to answer all our questions and assist us with directions and locations. There is very much activity in this area, especially on the weekends. It can get noisy, but it is also very enjoyable and entertaining. There is much history, and this hotel is located right in the middle of the historical area. We did not take cabs, but used the subway all the time. The fare was 20-cents. Sometimes it was crowded and other times not...just like NYC. Many of the tour books advise you to take a cab from your hotel. It's less complicated and much cooler. We had no problem with the metro/subway, but we also did not stand around looking like schmuck tourists trying to figure out directions on a map. There is security throughout the metro stations. They are clean and well maintained. Since the government buildings and the national cathedral are in the zocalo area, there were police and security everywhere. They were helpful and courteous. The pyramids - We took a metro to the north autobus terminal and took a modern air-conditioned bus (for 30 pesos $3.00 ) to the pyramids.... left at 11 a.m. and arrived at the pyramids at noon. If you climb to the top of the pyramid of the sun, be sure to touch the silver spot at the very top that marks the middle of the pyramid. The silver spot is approximately the size of a 50-cent piece. We caught another bus back to our hotel by the pyramid of the moon. The cost was a little cheaper. Chapultepec Park - We went to the park on the weekend when all the venders and the local people gather at the park. The Basilica of the Virgin of Guadalupe - We took a metro which stops approximately two-three blocks from the basilica. There are venders everywhere except on the church grounds. We visited many more sights and the hotel staff was very helpful in explaining the meaning of customs and traditions. All in all, it was a perfect location to a perfect trip.

Reviews.Title: “Superb location & great value”
Reviews.Author: Hemster7
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a week during 28Aor08 to 3May08. Overall this hotel is very good value. The location is unbeatable as you can walk to everywhere within 10 mins. During my stay the lobby bar was being renovated and the restaurant bar had no atmosphere. The food is okay, not excellent but just average. Service is below average. That said, there's no need to stay in the hotel for meals as there are some excellent restaurants in the vicinity. I highly recommend the famous Cafe Tacuba as well as the excellent El Vegetariano on Filomeno Mata (about 5 mins walk). Within a short walk are the old temples (Templo Mayor) as well as several old cathedrals. The old city has wonderful architecture and great boutique restaurants. If you crave the nightlife, Polanco has a lot to offer and is only 12-15 mins by taxi. I did not feel any concerns walking around by myself at night (sometimes as late as 1 am!). There are people around at all hours and also there are lots of police everywhere. Tip: If you don't like the noise then ask for an inside room. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “On the Zocalo, but quiet!”
Reviews.Author: RSFdowser
Reviews.Content: My family of 3 needed a place in DF before heading out after a week in Mexico. We knew we wanted to stay near the Zocalo, a central location with great restaurants and sights. The hotel was quiet (be sure to ask for a quiet room -- not on the street). The staff was helpful... and the roof top restaurant has a magical view of the Zolcalo and beyond. Had been concerned in the past about staying on the Zocalo because of the noise issue..... but this hotel proved me wrong.

Reviews.Title: “Watch the price you are quoted”
Reviews.Author: Pirate_UK
Reviews.Content: I reserved a room here for 4 nights through a travel website and was given a quote for the time I planned to stay. On arrival this quote had risen by 100 USD and I was told I had to pay or they would charge my credit card 25%. Not a great start. Room was clean and comfy but don't expect to sleep, organ grinders play from 10am all day, I think I can still hear the tune in my head. Plus drums and church bells too. Great location though for the historic places to see but very quiet at night, I tried the places in lonely planet and they were pretty dead, caught Metro to other areas in the end and got taxi home. Roof top restaurant is a great place for food and drinks if you can get a seat, its very popular with everyone. Wouldn't go back I have to say but it good value( well on my original quote) Enjoy Mexico

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Location!”
Reviews.Author: k374
Reviews.Content: This hotel is about a 3*, it is basic, clean and comfortable. It is located right near the zocalo (Mexico city's main square). The National Palace is also very close by opposite the square and so is the Metropolitan Cathedral. The street on which this hotel is located is quite busy and there are many interesting shops but even so it is quiet at night and I didn't find any noise. Staff was very helpful. The only downside is that the restaurants around the area are not to my liking. If you want to go to the clubs/nightlife this is not the area, for that you need to go to the heart of Zona Rosa. The metro station is a short 10 min walk across the square on the other side. The metro goes EVERYWHERE and is pretty damn good, it costs only 2 pesos so before using a taxi check it out.

Reviews.Title: “Good central location & clean”
Reviews.Author: AnaLondon
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed in this hotel for 3 nights, I choose it primarily for its location as it is very central and as a single woman traveller I wanted to avoid public transport and visit the town centre by foot as much as possible. I had initial concerns about noise, especially once I saw that my room window faced a fairly congested road however I felt better once I saw the windows were double-glazed and the rooms have thick curtains. I had sound sleep all 3 nights though no sleeping till late morning, by 8 -9 am you hear car honks and traffic. If you plan on sleeping till late I would not recommend a room which faces the street. I found that the computers in the lobby are really good for internet and e-mails however it is shame they only have 2 and at times you need to wait for your turn, they could do with adding another 2 or 3 computers for guests. The hotel staff were friendly and helpful, rooms were clean and pleasant, the only area I was not too impressed with was breakfast, they could do better and offer a better presentation & selection of fruit. I recommend this hotel if it is for a few days and your priority is location and cleanliness.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: julwork
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 3 nights on a business trip while filming a commercial for my client. The location was fantastic, being a single female traveler I was a little concerned but I felt safe walking around Zocalo alone. Cute street vendors, book markets, and live shows speckle the large Square. I had no issues with the drummers in the Square but I did not stay over a weekend. I would say this is probably the safest area in Mexico City to stay if it is your first time visiting. I agree the rooftop view is awesome and that the staff is very friendly. My room was tiny but extremely clean and well kept. Room service was nice and prompt, beautiful presentation as well. The hotel arranged for a cab driver to take me to the pyramids, saving me from the "drivers" that station themselves outside the hotel trying to get tourists as a fare. Overall a great place to stay and would stay there again if the opportunity arises.

Reviews.Title: “Almost Great”
Reviews.Author: texmacge
Reviews.Content: The Holiday Inn Zocalo is located in the historic center of Mexico City across the street from the Square (Zocalo) and the National Cathedral. It is a fantastic location for visiting the Aztec Ruins (Templo Mayor) and the Govenor's Palace (Diego Reviera's murals). There are lots of shops and restaurants within walking distance. The staff of the hotel are very friendly and helpful and our room was very clean and comfortable. The rooftop restaurant offers a fantastic view of the Zocalo and the city. There are a few things that one should consider if choosing this hotel. First, if you get a room close to the Zocalo, the Aztecs will anoy you with their very loud drumming until 10:00 or 11:00 PM. The drum is so loud that you not only hear it, but feel it as well. I took ear plugs and I couldn't shut it out. Second, don't get in a rush at the rooftop restaurant. Service is extraordinarily slow. I'm not talking about normal "Mexico slow," I'm talking slower. Third, we ordered room service each of our seven mornings there. The service was friendly, courteous, and fast. That is, until Lydia came on duty. That day we were treated rudely and we were served day old fruit (we didn't order fruit) and stale toast (we ordered Pan Dulce [Mexican Pastry]). When questioned about the order, Lydia became very argumentative. Language had nothing to do with it since my wife is fluent in Spanish. We complained to the Capitan about the treatment and received an apology and a complementary breakfast our last morning there. Fourth, the hotel will get you a fixed price taxi. The cars are clean and the drivers are courteous. The only problem is that every one of them will work you to take you somewhere else so they can line their pockets. We had one that wanted to take us shopping at a "special market" that ended up being just an oversized curio shop (only 100 pesos additional). Another one wanted to stop by a "special museum" and another that wanted to come by and take us to the airport for 200 pesos (the standard fare to the airport is 100 pesos). Fifth, leave specific instructions for water, towels, linens, etc. for the maids. A tip of 10 or 20 pesos will work wonders also. Since you can't drink the water in the hotel, you will use bottled water to brush your teeth. Ask for a couple of extra bottles. Sixth, don't bother exchanging dollars for pesos at the hotel. They were giving 10 pesos for 1 dollar and that is the rate vendors use if you pay for goods and services on the street. The exhange rate 12/12/07-12/18/07 was about 1 dollar for 10.65 pesos and about 10.90 pesos for 1 dollar. Seventh, most of us don't travel to watch TV. If you stay here, they have a limited selection of channels. 3 channels offer English programming: HBO Family, CNN International, and AXN (shows American reruns; some from the current season). Bottom line is that when we go to Mexico City again, we will likely stay in Colonia Polanco or Colonia Condessa in a hotel that offers a higher level of amenities and a broader selection of restaurants and lounges. If you want to stay in the Historic Center, try this hotel. Armed with knowledge of the seven cautions above, you will have a pleasant experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Friendly Service”
Reviews.Author: RhondaWhurl
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Holiday Inn Zocalo in early December, 2007 for 5 nights. I agree completely with those who praised the location, cleanliness and the friendly staff. The hotel has been renovated and is kept in excellent condition. We will definitely stay here when we return to Mexico City. I cannot comment on the breakfast buffet as we liked the CafÃ© El Popular just down the street. The view of the Zocalo from the large restaurant terrace is impressive (see the candid photos posted by pocsonâ€”it looks just like this) and we found the serving staff at dinner to be very helpful and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “A Good Place”
Reviews.Author: gggz99
Reviews.Content: We stayed 7 nights there. Our room was spotless. The Hotel clean and safe. The staff was extremely helpful. The location is perfect. All in all,we could not have asked for a better experience. My wife and I are not bar hoppers, so we didn't staty out after 7 p.m. at night. But we never felt threatened on any of the streets around the zocalo/almeda. Took the normal precautions. Would return in a heartbeat. Just sad that they don't offer two double beds or suites.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: bayrum
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Holiday Inn-Zocalo last week was perfect. The more I became familiar with the rest of the city, the more I appreciated our choice. As a photographer, I found the streets surrounding the hotel vibrant, authentic and surprisingly safe. The staff and service was excellent. The rooms are small, the bed is hard, yet it didn't really matter when a few steps out the door you were in the middle of where Mexica culture started and continues today. It really felt like home and was an incredible value, IMO.

Reviews.Title: “Best deal in Mexico city”
Reviews.Author: emc789456
Reviews.Content: Great hotel to stay in, right next to the Zocalo. Everything was very nice, I stayed here twice and the service was constant both times. The price is expensive if you are travelling on a student budget (as I was) but can be worth it if you are staying only for a couple of days.

Reviews.Title: “Really nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Arequipa
Reviews.Content: We happily stayed at the Holiday Inn Zocalo for four nights between tours of Guatemala and Mexico. We were very pleased with the location next to the main square (National Palace, Diego Rivera Murals, Cathedral, Templo Mayor and Museum) and many good restaurants. It had a sixth floor partially covered rooftop restaurant (the uncovered part had umbrellas) which overlooked the plaza and had very nice views. We ate only breakfast there, but it was delicious with a variety of Mexican and American dishes, nice fruit, cereal, yogurt and eggs cooked to order. There were two subway stops nearby so there was easy access to the rest of the city. The rooms were on the small, side but spotlessly clean and newly renovated. The closet was big enough to hold an opened suitcase. Our only down side with the hotel was the - is it a hurdy gurdy? - that played outside the hotel from around 11 am to 5 pm - the same song over and over and over. We weren't in the room much, but if we had come in tired from a flight we would not have been happy. We never saw anyone give them money so I've no idea how they earn a living. We would recommend this hotel for Mexico City.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Chompie
Reviews.Content: Great location - nice hotel. The restaurant on the roof overlooking the Zocalo is wonderful with pretty good food. The breakfast is very good.

Reviews.Title: “A good, characterful hotel, though some might find noise offputting”
Reviews.Author: mfhstid
Reviews.Content: Staying at the Holiday Inn Zocalo is not the usual kind of bland, reliable and forgettable experience associated with most Holiday Inns elsewhere. The place has a particular character that makes it memorable, largely (though not entirely) for the right reasons. The location is excellent, within effortless reach of all of the tourist sites in the Centrico Historico. By day, the liveliness of the surrounding streets makes casual meandering an enjoyable experience (and one thatâ€™s much less in-your-face than might be expected). By night, I wouldnâ€™t say the area is at all threatening, but the crowds of tourists â€“ and the even bigger crowds of people trying to sell things to tourists â€“ tend to disappear after about 9pm. The hotel itself has a nice ambience, its communal areas lacking the usual sterility of the big chain hotels. It feels very much a Mexican undertaking â€“ rather than an American one. The bar is small and pretty lifeless, but a perfectly decent meeting place before heading off to the rather more lively offerings elsewhere. The restaurant is on the top floor, with an outdoor terrace with agreeable views of the city. I only sampled breakfast, but the food on offer was good and the cost, although high by Mexican standards, was low in comparison to North America or Europe. The rooms again are some way off the usual you-could-be-anywhere experience associated with Holiday Inns et al. Their stripped down simplicity was for me a plus point, though some might miss the availability of internet access or zillions of channels of unwatchable US television. The overall feel is not unlike a decent quality Mediterranean hotel. The only real downside is the endless daytime noise from the uniformed hurdy-gurdy player (and his monkey) perched on a daily basis outside the front of the hotel. If you plan to stay in your room for any length of time during the day, the barrel organ and its depressingly repetitive repertoire could well be a major irritant. Proximity to the Zocalo - the epicentre of protest for Mexico - can also create noise at by day or night (though that's offset by the incredible spectacle of watching these serial protesters at work). All in all, though, the Holiday Inn Zocalo is a perfectly good place to stay, whether as a tourist or on business.

Reviews.Title: “perfect location”
Reviews.Author: pgrast
Reviews.Content: We loved the convenient location and the very friendly and helpful staff. The breakfast was incredible, with lovely fruit, food and service.

Reviews.Title: “A Gem of a Hotel for Tourists”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: For those on vacation to Mexico City, you can't get any better than this lovely hotel. Its location is perfect, overlooking a beautiful cathedral, the national palace, the ruins of the Aztec pyramids, and one of the largest squares in the world. More historical and cultural sites are within walking distance than we could possibly see in our 5 day stay. We arrived in the evening and had dinner on the terrace at the hotel restaurant, looking out over the historical center and the twinkling city lights. A breathtaking view by any standard. As late June is in the rainy season, the air was quite clean. The hotel's breakfast buffet is bountiful and delicious, and the prices reasonable. Our room was small, but very clean and had a nice high ceiling and a safe. By international standards, the price of the room was very reasonable. We recommend visiting the excavation of the Aztec pyramids next to the national cathedral, about a five minute walk from the hotel. Also, the food at the nearby Cafe de Tacuba is excellent. For visiting sites in other areas of the city (we loved visiting Frido Kahlo's "Blue House" in Coyoacan), the hotel will arrange for taxi service. The driver can take you from place to place, for a reasonable price. This is much safer and far more convenient than hailing taxis from the street.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, good location”
Reviews.Author: ridgeley
Reviews.Content: This is my second time staying here. I was there in May, 2005, also, while they were remodeling. The hotel looks much nicer after the remodel, plus they now have in-room wireless internet, which is handy. They also have a tiny business center where you can use their semi-high speed internet free for 30 min/day, plus print if you want. The room was clean, the safe worked, there was plentiful hot water and the toilets always flushed. If you have a street side room, you get a bit of street noise, but it's quiet by 8:00 or 9:00pm. Last year I had an inside room, and found the people noise echoing up the shaft to be much more annoying. Plus, with a street side room, you can open the windows, as the temps are very pleasant in Mexico City. When you figure in location (Zocalo), price ($82 for one double bed), and the Holiday Inn reputation, I just couldn't find a better value for mid-range tourist travel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel with one draw back”
Reviews.Author: yvr1
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Holdiay Inn Zocalo, located in the historic zone of the city. It is located just of the historic square, two blocks from the subway and near many fine restauruants and shops. The rooms, at least the one I had was small and compact, nice TV, large bed, shower in the bathroom. The room was immaculant, extremely clean, and well kept. My room looked out onto the street, 5 Cinco de Mayo. The lobby was nice, with a small bar, and internet service, free, limited to 30 minutes a day, after that it is 50 pesos, you can find much cheaper internet locations throughout the city. The staff was friendly. Two blocks up the street on 5 Cinco de Mayo and on the same side of the street was a great restaurant, La Capilla, I really suggest this restaurant. The hotel has a restaurant on the 6th floor, buffet for breakfast but a bit pricey for my liking, around $12.00USD, there is a Mac Donalds around the corner if your so inclined. Now for the one draw back of this hotel. During the day, and in the evening, into the late evening, 11pm or later, the Aztecs perform on the square and the sound of the drums beating constantly can be heard in the hotel rooms. If your a light sleeper, you are going to have a problem, no doubt about it, so take ear plugs with you, or you will not sleep. Other than that, this hotel is one that I can suggest, saying that, I would probably not stay at this property again due to noise from the drums at night.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights and I wish I could've stayed longer! The location is stunning, I loved looking outside and see the historic side of the city! The hotel is in excellent condition and is very cute. The bathroom is very confortable and the room in great shape and super clean. The area is not dangerous and it was great to walk around. I would definetely stay here everytime I go back. The breakfast buffet was delicious and the terrace on the top was great to get a bautiful view of mexico city. The service was superb. Everyone was very friendly at anytime of the day.

Reviews.Title: “liked the zocalo”
Reviews.Author: jethro56
Reviews.Content: Stated twice in march, first visit was for one night only and was given room facing side street which was slightly claustrophobic with a little bed (we are both near 6 ft) service was excellent, breakfast superb, and left 5 pieces of luggage for 9 days while we flew to Cuba. On return were given room / suite on 5th floor facing the Plaza, room size and bed are excellent as well as service, all our luggage was bought to our room within 15 minutes of arrival all exactly as we had left it 9 days ago. Security is excellent and staff are helpfu but at times the lack of english and our lack of spanish has been challenging! Would stay again if returning to Mexico City in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Holiday Inn Zocalo”
Reviews.Author: iowagirl9
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Holiday Inn Zocalo for 8 nights in the second week of December. I was traveling solo, and worried a bit about security but I needn't have. The hotel was reassuringly attractive, clean, well-staffed, lively, and friendly. It is perfectly situated in the city, particularly for this time of year with all of the musical and holiday festivities on the (extremely well-policed) Zocalo. My room was spotless, quiet (get one that faces Cinco de Mayo street), and there was always computer access (and free fruit and candy!) in the reception. You could have a beer from the lobby bar and do your email after calling it a night; and the cable tv had so many channels that there was always "free" entertainment after the pleasures of a day traipsing around the city. The location could not be better; the staff was friendly and neither pushy nor stand-offish. Ideal. I'll recommend it to everyone and use it again.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: tosl
Reviews.Content: Very pleasant stay in a sometimes hectic city. Easy access throughout the city but use their taxis and drivers, DO NOT ATTEMPT TO DRIVE ANYWHERE IN OR NEAR MEXICO CITY - WE WERE LOST FOR FOUR HOURS JUST GETTING FROM THE AIRPORT. The view from the terrace restaurant is great and the breakfast is good. skip the dinner.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy but nice.”
Reviews.Author: eerikson
Reviews.Content: Before you decide to stay on the Zocalo, consider this: Sounds echo around the plaza and the Aztec drummers/dancers perform from 10:00 - 10:00 making it difficult to take a siesta. Other than that, we had a wonderful 4 day stay. The staff was extremely friendly and helpful and switched from Spanish to English and back easily (we speak Spanish). The 6th floor terrace restaurant is a must even if you don't stay at the hotel - fantastic views although you will find more exciting food elsewhere. Have the $10 breakfast buffet or, later, coffee or a drink. You will see the cathedral up close, the volcanos, and the action in the plaza. We decided to spend the exta money and had a somewhat nice 5th floor suite that was more like a loft with large windows on 2 sides and a great view of the Zocalo. Service and attention were great. Some rooms have windows over a busy street (5 de mayo) and others have windows into a light/ventelation shaft. Overall, a pleasant hotel in a great (although noisy) location.

Reviews.Title: “Great value - clean, good location, very friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: milehighsigh
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Holiday Inn Zocalo for one night at the end of September. Did not notice any funny smells and thought everything was great. The room did not seem too small - good closet space, had a/c and tv with a few channels in english. Location right next to the Zocalo cannot be beat! The staff was super-friendly the entire time, from check-in to the restaurant to calling us a taxi at check-out. Would definitely stay there again if I went back to Mexico City!

Reviews.Title: “Love the patio restaurant”
Reviews.Author: meggray
Reviews.Content: Very small, but clean rooms. Double occupancy means 2 twin beds. Non-potable water in bathroom, but they give you two bottles of water fre. Air. Very good room service. Staff courteous and efficient. Excellent patio restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “A great Location”
Reviews.Author: Patricia_Wells
Reviews.Content: A great Hotel, clean and a great terrace on the roof with a decent enough restaurant. It is close to everything in Centro Historica district. Easy to pick up a turibus and a subway entrance in front of the Catedral. Very helpful staff. And the rooms are actually quite large and spacious for a non- US hotel, we upgraded to a Junoir Suite Would stay here again.!

Reviews.Title: “OK for dwarfs”
Reviews.Author: worldtravs
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Holiday Inn in March 2005. The rooms were the smallest we have ever encountered in a hotel. Otherwise, the position was great, if a little noisy at times, and the breakfast on the rooftop restaurant most enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: elgarbo
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Holiday Inn for three nights in January and loved our time there. The staff were helpful, helping us with whatever problems we encountered along the way. Despite the early afternoon check in time, we were taken to our room immediately after arriving from the airport at 8 in the morning. The rooftop restaurant was spectacular for both views and food, the bar downstairs very convenient. The bar downstairs was nice and the internet at the lobby extremely convenient. Despite there being a half hour free 'trial' of the internet, we used it a great deal more and were never charged for the privelege. Rooms were comfortable, although the beds were a little hard. Certainly nothing worth losing sleep over though. All in all, a very enjoyable time spent in the Holiday Inn.
